thread.title: Brexit & Beyond: Europe Trails America Like Never Before

author: WSJ Staff
title: Brexit & Beyond: Europe Trails America Like Never Before

organizations.name: europe trails america like never before  u.s.

text:
MUST READS
U.S. Profit Boom Leaves Europe Trailing : The eurozone’s economy has outpaced the U.S. for the past two years, yet its corporate profits are trailing those in America like never before.
As Merkel Visits China, German Businesses Question Their Prospects : Trade between Germany and China reached an all-time record last year. But when Chancellor Angela Merkel visits the country this week, she will carry a growing list of concerns from a wary business delegation.
Europe’s Latest Fix for Its Banks: Opaque Trades: A European government-controlled fund is delving deeper into opaque trades that could potentially expose taxpayers to bank losses—something post-financial crisis rules were meant to protect against.
Trump Is Targeting 10% Cut in EU Steel, Aluminum Exports to U.S. : President Donald Trump is weighing measures to cut European Union steel and aluminum exports to the U.S. by about 10%, in a sign the bloc’s concessions to secure tariff exemptions aren’t meeting White House demands, EU officials familiar with the talks said.
Facebook CEO Dodges Tough Questions by EU Lawmakers : Mark Zuckerberg apologized to European Union lawmakers over the fake-news and privacy scandals engulfing Facebook but rebuffed suggestions that the company has outsize market power and avoided responding to many difficult questions.
How Bad Can Things Get for Italian Markets? : The prospective antiestablishment government of Italy has shocked markets, with bond yields jumping higher on the potential for anti-euro policy positions and a burst of new government spending.
Italy’s Conte Faces Education Questions : Italy’s 5 Star Movement defended its proposed prime minister Tuesday after a report raised questions about whether he inflated his academic credentials.
Eurozone Economic Rebound Remains Out of Reach : Business activity in the eurozone slowed for the fourth straight month in May and more sharply than expected, a survey of manufacturers and service providers showed, a sign that economic growth has yet to rebound from a surprisingly weak showing in the first quarter.
French Unemployment Rises : French unemployment rose in the first quarter of the year, the latest indication that the surging eurozone recovery of 2017 is losing momentum in 2018.
Airbus, EU Say Plane Subsidies Are Over; U.S. Disagrees : The U.S. and European Union clashed anew in a massive aircraft subsidy dispute when Washington rejected Airbus’ claim that it had satisfied World Trade Organization demands with a new European loan agreement.
IN THE PAPERS
Since the Brexit Vote, the Number of Brits Becoming German Citizens is Soaring – Quartz
U.K. Conservatives Start to Turn Minds Beyond Brexit Trauma – Financial Times
Take U.K. Out of Customs Union as Fast as Possible, Boris Johnson tells Theresa May – The Times
Europeans Love the EU (And Populists Too) – Politico
Macron Vowed to Make France a ‘Start-Up Nation.’ Is It Getting There? – New York Times
 Brexit & Beyond: Zuckerberg Enters the Lion's Den
